That's a great approach! Using your yoga app for meditation is a convenient way to get started, and you can always explore dedicated meditation apps later to supplement your practice.

By using your yoga app, you'll be able to:

* Leverage your existing familiarity with the app and its interface
* Take advantage of the meditation features and content they offer
* Easily integrate meditation into your existing yoga practice

And, by exploring dedicated meditation apps, you'll be able to:

* Discover new features and content that might not be available on your yoga app
* Find meditation-specific tools and techniques to help you deepen your practice
* Experiment with different approaches and styles to find what resonates with you

Remember, the key is to find what works for you and to make meditation a consistent part of your daily routine. Don't be afraid to try new things and adjust your approach as needed.

Some popular dedicated meditation apps you might want to explore include:

* Headspace: Known for its gamified approach and personalized meditation plans
* Calm: Offers a wide range of meditation content, including sleep stories and relaxing music
* Insight Timer: Provides a large library of free meditation content, as well as a timer for tracking your personal practice
* Meditation Studio: Offers a variety of meditation classes and courses, led by experienced teachers

Feel free to explore these apps and others to find the one that resonates with you the most.

Remember, the most important thing is to establish a consistent meditation practice that brings you joy and benefits your mental and emotional well-being. Good luck on your meditation journey!
